FRED Series

Sam Boysel

2018-07-18

Source: vignettes/fredr-series.Rmd
fredr-series.Rmd

Introduction

This vignette is intended to introduce the user to fredr functions for the Series endpoint of the FRED API.

FRED series are the primary data objects in the FRED database, each with string identifier. For example:

  • Civilian Unemployment Rate (series_id = "UNRATE")
  • Real Gross National Product (series_id = "GNPCA")
  • Effective Federal Funds Rate (series_id = "FEDFUNDS")

FRED series are assigned categories and tags attributes for organization and classification. The following examples illustrate the Series endpoint functions implements in fredr.

Retrieve observations

The function fredr(), an alias for fredr_series_observations(), is the core function in fredr for fetching FRED data series. See the Get started article and fredr() for usage examples.

Search for FRED series

Use fredr_series_search_text() to search for a series by text in the series description. For example:

fredr_series_search_text(
  search_text = "unemployment",
  limit = 100L
)
#> # A tibble: 100 x 16
#>    id      realtime_start realtime_end title              observation_sta…
#>  * <chr>   <chr>          <chr>        <chr>              <chr>           
#>  1 UNRATE  2018-07-18     2018-07-18   Civilian Unemploy… 1948-01-01      
#>  2 UNRATE… 2018-07-18     2018-07-18   Civilian Unemploy… 1948-01-01      
#>  3 NROU    2018-07-18     2018-07-18   Natural Rate of U… 1949-01-01      
#>  4 UNEMPL… 2018-07-18     2018-07-18   Unemployment Level 1948-01-01      
#>  5 M0892A… 2018-07-18     2018-07-18   Unemployment Rate… 1929-04-01      
#>  6 Q0892B… 2018-07-18     2018-07-18   Unemployment Rate… 1940-04-01      
#>  7 M0892B… 2018-07-18     2018-07-18   Unemployment Rate… 1940-01-01      
#>  8 M0892C… 2018-07-18     2018-07-18   Unemployment Rate… 1947-01-01      
#>  9 LNS140… 2018-07-18     2018-07-18   Unemployment Rate… 1948-01-01      
#> 10 U6RATE  2018-07-18     2018-07-18   Total unemployed,… 1994-01-01      
#> # ... with 90 more rows, and 11 more variables: observation_end <chr>,
#> #   frequency <chr>, frequency_short <chr>, units <chr>,
#> #   units_short <chr>, seasonal_adjustment <chr>,
#> #   seasonal_adjustment_short <chr>, last_updated <chr>, popularity <int>,
#> #   group_popularity <int>, notes <chr>

Use fredr_series_search_id() to search for a series by integer ID of the series. For example:

fredr_series_search_id(
  search_text = "UNRATE",
  limit = 100L
)
#> # A tibble: 16 x 16
#>    id     realtime_start realtime_end title               observation_sta…
#>  * <chr>  <chr>          <chr>        <chr>               <chr>           
#>  1 UNRATE 2018-07-18     2018-07-18   Civilian Unemploym… 1948-01-01      
#>  2 UNRAT… 2018-07-18     2018-07-18   FOMC Summary of Ec… 2018-01-01      
#>  3 UNRAT… 2018-07-18     2018-07-18   Longer Run FOMC Su… 2009-02-18      
#>  4 UNRAT… 2018-07-18     2018-07-18   FOMC Summary of Ec… 2018-01-01      
#>  5 UNRAT… 2018-07-18     2018-07-18   Longer Run FOMC Su… 2009-02-18      
#>  6 UNRAT… 2018-07-18     2018-07-18   FOMC Summary of Ec… 2018-01-01      
#>  7 UNRAT… 2018-07-18     2018-07-18   Longer Run FOMC Su… 2009-02-18      
#>  8 UNRAT… 2018-07-18     2018-07-18   FOMC Summary of Ec… 2018-01-01      
#>  9 UNRAT… 2018-07-18     2018-07-18   Longer Run FOMC Su… 2015-06-17      
#> 10 UNRAT… 2018-07-18     2018-07-18   Civilian Unemploym… 1948-01-01      
#> 11 UNRAT… 2018-07-18     2018-07-18   FOMC Summary of Ec… 2018-01-01      
#> 12 UNRAT… 2018-07-18     2018-07-18   Longer Run FOMC Su… 2009-02-18      
#> 13 UNRAT… 2018-07-18     2018-07-18   FOMC Summary of Ec… 2018-01-01      
#> 14 UNRAT… 2018-07-18     2018-07-18   Longer Run FOMC Su… 2009-02-18      
#> 15 UNRAT… 2018-07-18     2018-07-18   FOMC Summary of Ec… 2018-01-01      
#> 16 UNRAT… 2018-07-18     2018-07-18   Longer Run FOMC Su… 2009-02-18      
#> # ... with 11 more variables: observation_end <chr>, frequency <chr>,
#> #   frequency_short <chr>, units <chr>, units_short <chr>,
#> #   seasonal_adjustment <chr>, seasonal_adjustment_short <chr>,
#> #   last_updated <chr>, popularity <int>, group_popularity <int>,
#> #   notes <chr>

Search for FRED series by tags

Use fredr_series_search_tags() to search for series tags

fredr_series_search_tags(
  series_search_text = "unemployment",
  limit = 100L
)
#> # A tibble: 100 x 6
#>    name         group_id notes          created    popularity series_count
#>  * <chr>        <chr>    <chr>          <chr>           <int>        <int>
#>  1 unemployment gen      ""             2012-02-2…         75        23892
#>  2 nsa          seas     Not Seasonall… 2012-02-2…        100        23173
#>  3 usa          geo      United States… 2012-02-2…         99        18376
#>  4 bls          src      Bureau of Lab… 2012-02-2…         85        14408
#>  5 rate         gen      ""             2012-02-2…         87        14216
#>  6 nation       geot     ""             2012-02-2…        100        12647
#>  7 annual       freq     ""             2012-02-2…         91        11127
#>  8 mei          rls      Main Economic… 2012-08-1…         78        10770
#>  9 oecd         src      Org. for Econ… 2012-02-2…         78        10770
#> 10 county       geot     County or Cou… 2012-02-2…         77         9504
#> # ... with 90 more rows

Search for FRED series by related tags

Use fredr_search_related_tags() to search for series tags related to a given tag. For example, to search for tags related to the tag “usa” in which the series text matches “gnp”, use the following:

fredr_series_search_related_tags(
  series_search_text = "gnp",
  tag_names = "usa",
  limit = 30L
)
#> # A tibble: 30 x 6
#>    name      group_id notes            created     popularity series_count
#>  * <chr>     <chr>    <chr>            <chr>            <int>        <int>
#>  1 nation    geot     ""               2012-02-27…        100           61
#>  2 gnp       gen      Gross National … 2012-02-27…         46           46
#>  3 quarterly freq     ""               2012-02-27…         85           41
#>  4 bea       src      Bureau of Econo… 2012-02-27…         79           37
#>  5 nipa      rls      National Income… 2012-08-16…         72           37
#>  6 sa        seas     Seasonally Adju… 2012-02-27…         87           36
#>  7 gdp       gen      Gross Domestic … 2012-02-27…         83           30
#>  8 nsa       seas     Not Seasonally … 2012-02-27…        100           25
#>  9 nber      src      National Bureau… 2012-02-27…         60           22
#> 10 annual    freq     ""               2012-02-27…         91           20
#> # ... with 20 more rows

Return basic information for a FRED series

See fredr_series() for additional details.

Return the categories for a FRED series

See fredr_series_categories() for additional details.

Return the release for a FRED series

See fredr_series_release() for additional details.

Return the tags for a FRED series

See fredr_series_tags() for additional details

Return a set of recently updated FRED series

See fredr_series_updates() for additional details.

Get the data vintage dates for a FRED series

See fredr_series_vintagedates() for additiional details
